00031 chol_solve_as::chol_solve_as (const int N) : ecL(N)
00032 {
00033     nu = new double[NUM_VAR*N];
00034     XiHg = new double[NUM_VAR*N];
00035     z = new double[NUM_VAR*N];
00036 
00037     icL = new double*[N*2];
00038     icL_mem = new double[NUM_VAR*N*N*2];
00039     for(int i = 0; i < N*2; i++)
00040     {
00041         icL[i] = &icL_mem[i * NUM_VAR*N];
00042     }
00043 }

00045 
00046 chol_solve_as::~chol_solve_as()
00047 {
00048     if (icL != NULL)
00049     {
00050         delete icL_mem;
00051         delete icL;
00052     }
00053     if (z != NULL)
00054         delete z;
00055     if (nu != NULL)
00056         delete nu;
00057     if (XiHg != NULL)
00058         delete XiHg;
00059 }

00071 void chol_solve_as::form_sa_row(
00072         const problem_parameters* ppar, 
00073         const int ic_num, 
00074         const int var_num, 
00075         double *row)
00076 {
00077     double aiH = ppar->i2Q[0]; // a'*inv(H) = a'*inv(H)*a
00078     int state_num = var_num / 2; // number of state in the preview window
00079     int first_num = state_num * NUM_STATE_VAR; // first !=0 element
00080     double aiHcosA;
00081     double aiHsinA;
00082 
00083 
00084     // reset memory
00085     memset(row, 0, (NUM_STATE_VAR * ppar->N + ic_num) * sizeof(double));
00086 
00087     aiHcosA = aiH * ppar->spar[state_num].cos;
00088     aiHsinA = aiH * ppar->spar[state_num].sin;
00089 
00090     // compute elements of 'a'
00091     if (var_num%2 == 0)   // constraint on z_x
00092     {
00093         // a * -R
00094         row[first_num] = -aiHcosA;
00095         row[first_num + 3] = -aiHsinA;
00096 
00097         // a * A'*R'
00098         if (state_num != ppar->N-1)
00099         {
00100             row[first_num + 6] = aiHcosA;
00101             row[first_num + 9] = aiHsinA;
00102         }
00103     }
00104     else  // constraint on z_y
00105     {   
00106         // a * -R
00107         row[first_num] = aiHsinA;
00108         row[first_num + 3] = -aiHcosA;
00109 
00110         // a * A'*R'
00111         if (state_num != ppar->N-1)
00112         {
00113             row[first_num + 6] = -aiHsinA;
00114             row[first_num + 9] = aiHcosA;
00115         }
00116     }
00117 
00118     // initialize the last element in the row
00119     row[ic_num + ppar->N*NUM_STATE_VAR] = aiH;
00120 }

00123 
00132 void chol_solve_as::solve(
00133         const problem_parameters* ppar, 
00134         const double *iHg,
00135         const double *x, 
00136         double *dx)
00137 {
00138     double *s_nu = nu;
00139     int i;
00140     double i2Q[3] = {ppar->i2Q[0], ppar->i2Q[1], ppar->i2Q[2]};
00141 
00142 
00143     // generate L
00144     ecL.form (ppar);
00145 
00146     // -(x + inv(H) * g)
00147     //  x - initial feasible point
00148     for (i = 0; i < NUM_VAR * ppar->N; i++)
00149     {
00150         XiHg[i] = -x[i];
00151     }
00152     for (i = 0; i < 2*ppar->N; i++)
00153     {
00154         XiHg[i*3] -= iHg[i];
00155     }
00156 
00157     // obtain s = E * x;
00158     E.form_Ex (ppar, XiHg, s_nu);
00159 
00160     // obtain nu
00161     ecL.solve_forward(ppar->N, s_nu);
00162     // make copy of z - it is constant
00163     for (i = 0; i < NUM_STATE_VAR * ppar->N; i++)
00164     {
00165         z[i] = s_nu[i];
00166     }
00167     ecL.solve_backward(ppar->N, s_nu);
00168 
00169     // E' * nu
00170     E.form_ETx (ppar, s_nu, dx);
00171 
00172     
00173     // dx = -iH*(grad + E'*nu)
00174     //
00175     // dx = -(x + inv(H) * g + inv(H) * E' * nu)
00176     //        ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~            ~~~~~~~
00177     // dx   -(   -XiHg       + inv(H) *   dx   ) 
00178     for (i = 0; i < ppar->N*NUM_STATE_VAR; i++)
00179     {
00180         // dx for state variables
00181         dx[i] = XiHg[i] - i2Q[i%3] * dx[i];
00182     }
00183     for (; i < ppar->N*NUM_VAR; i++)
00184     {
00185         // dx for control variables
00186         dx[i] = XiHg[i] - ppar->i2P * dx[i];
00187     }
00188 }

00202 void chol_solve_as::up_resolve(
00203         const problem_parameters* ppar, 
00204         const double *iHg,
00205         const int nW, 
00206         const int *W, 
00207         const double *x, 
00208         double *dx)
00209 {
00210     update (ppar, nW, W);
00211     update_z (ppar, iHg, nW, W, x);
00212     resolve (ppar, iHg, nW, W, x, dx);
00213 }

00215 
00224 void chol_solve_as::update (const problem_parameters* ppar, const int nW, const int *W)
00225 {
00226     int i, j, k;
00227 
00228     int ic_num = nW-1; // index of added constraint in W
00229     int state_num = W[ic_num] / 2; // number of state in the preview window
00230     double *new_row = icL[ic_num]; // current row in icL
00231 
00232     int last_num = ic_num + ppar->N*NUM_STATE_VAR; // the last !=0 element
00233 
00234     // a matrix on diagonal of ecL
00235     double* ecL_diag = &ecL.ecL[state_num * MATRIX_SIZE_3x3 * 2];
00236     // a matrix below the ecL_diag
00237     double* ecL_ndiag = &ecL.ecL[state_num * MATRIX_SIZE_3x3 * 2 + MATRIX_SIZE_3x3];
00238 
00239 
00240     // form row 'a' in the current row of icL
00241     form_sa_row(ppar, ic_num, W[ic_num], new_row);
00242 
00243     // update elements starting from the first non-zero
00244     // element in the row to NUM_STATE_VAR * N (size of ecL)
00245     // the calculation of the last elements is completed
00246     // in a separate loop
00247     // each number in row 'a' causes update of only 3 elements following
00248     // it, they can be 1,2,6; 1,5,6; 4,5,6
00249     k = state_num*NUM_STATE_VAR;
00250     double* cur_pos = &new_row[k];
00251     for(i = state_num*2; i < ppar->N*2; i++) // variables corresponding to x and 
00252     {                                  // y are computed using the same matrices
00253         double tmp_copy_el[3];
00254 
00255         // ----------------------------------------------------------------
00256         cur_pos[0] /= ecL_diag[0];
00257         tmp_copy_el[0] = cur_pos[0];
00258         cur_pos[1] -= tmp_copy_el[0] * ecL_diag[1];
00259         cur_pos[1] /= ecL_diag[4];
00260         tmp_copy_el[1] = cur_pos[1];
00261         cur_pos[2] -= tmp_copy_el[0] * ecL_diag[2] + tmp_copy_el[1] * ecL_diag[5];
00262         
00263 
00264         // ----------------------------------------------------------------
00265         cur_pos[2] /= ecL_diag[8];
00266         tmp_copy_el[2] = cur_pos[2];
00267         if (i < 2*(ppar->N - 1))  // non-diagonal matrix of ecL cannot be
00268         {                   // used when the last state is processed
00269 
00270             // these elements can be updated here, since they are not 
00271             // used in computation of other elements on this iteration
00272             cur_pos[6] -= tmp_copy_el[0] * ecL_ndiag[0] 
00273                         + tmp_copy_el[1] * ecL_ndiag[3]
00274                         + tmp_copy_el[2] * ecL_ndiag[6];
00275 
00276             cur_pos[7] -= tmp_copy_el[1] * ecL_ndiag[4]
00277                         + tmp_copy_el[2] * ecL_ndiag[7];
00278 
00279             cur_pos[8] -= tmp_copy_el[2] * ecL_ndiag[8];
00280 
00281             if ((i+1)%2 == 0) // jump to the next pair of matrices in ecL.
00282             {
00283                 ecL_diag = &ecL_diag[MATRIX_SIZE_3x3 * 2];
00284                 ecL_ndiag = &ecL_ndiag[MATRIX_SIZE_3x3 * 2];
00285             }
00286         }
00287         // update the last (diagonal) number in the row
00288         new_row[last_num] -= tmp_copy_el[0] * tmp_copy_el[0] 
00289                            + tmp_copy_el[1] * tmp_copy_el[1] 
00290                            + tmp_copy_el[2] * tmp_copy_el[2];
00291 
00292         // update elements after N*NUM_STATE_VAR using the previously added rows
00293         // in icL
00294         for (j = 0; j < ic_num; j++)
00295         {
00296             new_row[ppar->N*NUM_STATE_VAR + j] -= tmp_copy_el[0] * icL[j][k]
00297                                           + tmp_copy_el[1] * icL[j][k+1]
00298                                           + tmp_copy_el[2] * icL[j][k+2];
00299         }
00300         cur_pos = &cur_pos[3];
00301         k += 3;
00302     }
00303 
00304     // update elements in the end of icL
00305     for(i = NUM_STATE_VAR * ppar->N; i < last_num; i++)
00306     {
00307         new_row[i] /= icL[i - ppar->N*NUM_STATE_VAR][i];
00308         double tmp_copy_el = new_row[i];
00309 
00310         // determine number in the row of L
00311 
00312         // update the last (diagonal) number in the row
00313         new_row[last_num] -= tmp_copy_el * tmp_copy_el;
00314 
00315         for (j = (i - ppar->N*NUM_STATE_VAR) + 1; j < ic_num; j++)
00316         {
00317             new_row[ppar->N*NUM_STATE_VAR + j] -= tmp_copy_el * icL[j][i];
00318         }
00319     }
00320 
00321     // square root of the diagonal element
00322     new_row[last_num] = sqrt(new_row[last_num]);
00323 }

00326 
00336 void chol_solve_as::update_z (
00337         const problem_parameters* ppar, 
00338         const double *iHg,
00339         const int nW, 
00340         const int *W, 
00341         const double *x)
00342 {
00343     int ic_num = nW-1; // index of added constraint in W
00344     // update lagrange multipliers
00345     int zind = ppar->N*NUM_STATE_VAR + ic_num;
00346     // sn
00347     double zn = -iHg[W[ic_num]] - x[W[ic_num]*3];
00348 
00349     // zn
00350     for (int i = 0; i < zind; i++)
00351     {
00352         zn -= z[i] * icL[ic_num][i];
00353         nu[i] = z[i];
00354     }
00355     nu[zind] = z[zind] = zn/icL[ic_num][zind];
00356     return;
00357 }

00359 
00360 
00372 void chol_solve_as::resolve (
00373         const problem_parameters* ppar, 
00374         const double *iHg,
00375         const int nW, 
00376         const int *W, 
00377         const double *x, 
00378         double *dx)
00379 {
00380     int i,j;
00381 
00382     double i2Q[3] = {ppar->i2Q[0], ppar->i2Q[1], ppar->i2Q[2]};
00383 
00384 
00385     // backward substituition for icL
00386     for (i = NUM_STATE_VAR*ppar->N + nW-1; i >= NUM_STATE_VAR*ppar->N; i--)
00387     {
00388         double nui = nu[i];
00389         double *icL_row = icL[i-ppar->N*NUM_STATE_VAR];
00390 
00391         nui = nui / icL_row[i];
00392         for (j = i - 1; j >= 0; j--)
00393         {
00394             nu[j] -= nui * icL_row[j];
00395         }
00396         nu[i] = nui;
00397     }
00398     // backward substituition for ecL
00399     ecL.solve_backward(ppar->N, nu);
00400 
00401 
00402     // E' * nu
00403     E.form_ETx (ppar, nu, dx);
00404 
00405     // dx = -iH*(grad + E'*nu  + A(W,:)'*lambda)
00406     //
00407     // dx = -(x + inv(H) * g + inv(H) * E' * nu)
00408     //            ~~~~~~~~~~            ~~~~~~~
00409     // dx   -(x +  iHg       + inv(H) *   dx   ) 
00410     for (i = 0; i < ppar->N*NUM_STATE_VAR; i++)
00411     {
00412         // dx for state variables
00413         dx[i] = -x[i] - i2Q[i%3] * dx[i];
00414     }
00415     for (; i < ppar->N*NUM_VAR; i++)
00416     {
00417         // dx for control variables
00418         dx[i] = -x[i] - ppar->i2P * dx[i];
00419     }
00420     for (i = 0; i < 2*ppar->N; i++)
00421     {
00422         // dx for state variables
00423         dx[i*3] -= iHg[i];
00424     }
00425 
00426     // -iH * A(W,:)' * lambda
00427     double *lambda = &nu[ppar->N*NUM_STATE_VAR];
00428     for (i = 0; i < nW; i++)
00429     {
00430         dx[W[i]*3] -= i2Q[0] * lambda[i];
00431     }
00432 }

00436 #ifdef QPAS_DOWNDATE
00437 
00451 void chol_solve_as::down_resolve(
00452         const problem_parameters* ppar, 
00453         const double *iHg,
00454         const int nW, 
00455         const int *W, 
00456         const int ind_exclude, 
00457         const double *x, 
00458         double *dx)
00459 {
00460     // for each element of z affected by removed constraint
00461     // find a base that stays the same
00462     double z_tmp = 0;
00463     for (int i = nW; i > ind_exclude; i--)
00464     {
00465         int zind = ppar->N*NUM_STATE_VAR + i;
00466         double zn = z[zind] * icL[i][zind];
00467         z[zind] = z_tmp;
00468 
00469         for (int j = ppar->N*NUM_STATE_VAR + ind_exclude; j < zind; j++)
00470         {
00471             zn += z[j] * icL[i][j];
00472         }
00473         z_tmp = zn;
00474     }
00475     z[ppar->N*NUM_STATE_VAR + ind_exclude] = z_tmp;
00476 
00477 
00478     // downdate L
00479     downdate (ppar, nW, ind_exclude, x);
00480 
00481 
00482     // recompute elements of z
00483     for (int i = ind_exclude; i < nW; i++)
00484     {
00485         int zind = ppar->N*NUM_STATE_VAR + i;
00486         double zn = z[zind];
00487 
00488         // zn
00489         // start from the first !=0 element
00490         for (int j = ppar->N*NUM_STATE_VAR+ind_exclude; j < zind; j++)
00491         {
00492             zn -= z[j] * icL[i][j];
00493         }
00494         z[zind] = zn/icL[i][zind];
00495     }
00496 
00497     // copy z to nu
00498     for (int i = 0; i < ppar->N*NUM_STATE_VAR + nW; i++)
00499     {
00500         nu[i] = z[i];
00501     }
00502 
00503 
00504     resolve (ppar, iHg, nW, W, x, dx);
00505 }

00513 double * chol_solve_as::get_lambda(const problem_parameters* ppar)
00514 {
00515     return(&nu[NUM_STATE_VAR*ppar->N]);
00516 }

00520 
00529 void chol_solve_as::downdate(
00530         const problem_parameters* ppar, 
00531         const int nW, 
00532         const int ind_exclude, 
00533         const double *x)
00534 {
00535     // Shuffle memory pointers to avoid copying of the data.
00536     double * downdate_row = icL[ind_exclude];
00537     for (int i = ind_exclude + 1; i < nW + 1; i++)
00538     {
00539         icL[i-1] = icL[i];
00540     }
00541     icL[nW] = downdate_row;
00542 
00543 
00544     for (int i = ind_exclude; i < nW; i++)
00545     {
00546         int el_index = NUM_STATE_VAR*ppar->N + i;
00547         double *cur_el = &icL[i][el_index];
00548         double x1 = cur_el[0];
00549         double x2 = cur_el[1];
00550         double cosT, sinT;
00551 
00552 
00553         // Givens rotation matrix
00554         if (abs(x2) >= abs(x1))
00555         {
00556             double t = x1/x2;
00557             sinT = 1/sqrt(1 + t*t);
00558             cosT = sinT*t;
00559         }
00560         else
00561         {
00562             double t = x2/x1;
00563             cosT = 1/sqrt(1 + t*t);
00564             sinT = cosT*t;
00565         }
00566 
00567 
00568         // update elements in the current line
00569         cur_el[0] = cosT*x1 + sinT*x2;
00570         cur_el[1] = 0;
00571 
00572         // change sign if needed (diagonal elements of Cholesky 
00573         // decomposition must be positive)
00574         double sign = copysign(1, cur_el[0]);
00575         cur_el[0] = fabs(cur_el[0]);
00576 
00577         // update the lines below the current one.
00578         for (int j = i + 1; j < nW; j++)
00579         {
00580             x1 = icL[j][el_index];
00581             x2 = icL[j][el_index + 1];
00582 
00583             icL[j][el_index] = sign * (cosT*x1 + sinT*x2);
00584             icL[j][el_index + 1] = -sinT*x1 + cosT*x2;
00585         }
00586     }
00587 }
00588 #endif
